title: Fan, 1760–80
description: Pleated fan. Leaf of painted parchment backed with painted paper; sticks of incised and pierced mother-of-pearl with applied metallic foil; glass stone at the rivet. The figures in the central frame are after a painting by Jean Baptiste Joseph Pater (1695-1736) entitled, "Conversation Galante dans un Parc." The patially visible pen and ink drawing on the left is signed Perelle and is probably a copy of a countryside view by the painter and engraver, Gabriel Perelle (1603-77). Scattered framed pictures and the twisting ribbon motif create a trompe l'oeil effect.

tombstone.epitaph:
Fan, 1760–80.
1760–80. H x W (open): 27.3 x 47 cm (10 3/4 x 18 1/2 in.). Gift of Anonymous Donor. 1952-161-216.
